title: Debugger mixes together mapping keys from different failed contract creations
body:
## Issue

I just realized we don't have an open issue for this (even though this has been a thing for a while)... I don't think it's particularly high-priority, but I figure it ought to at least be listed somewhere.

Suppose you have a transaction with multiple failed contract creations, each of which was initiated was the `CREATE` opcode (as opposed to `CREATE2`, and as opposed to being the initial transaction).  Then the debugger will not distinguish their mapping keys from one another; any mapping keys in one will also be applied to all the others.

Note that once we've done something about #2894, this issue should basically go away; and until we do something about #2894, I don't see any easy way of addressing this (although it's not necessarily impossible).

## Steps to Reproduce

Use the `Tester` contract from the `creation-failure` test case in `solidity-test-cases`.  Run `mixup(2)`; be sure to give it a lot of gas, as otherwise it'll run out.

## Expected Behavior

In the inner most constructor invocation before the result, the value of `mixup` ought to be displayed as `Map { 0 => 81 }`.

## Actual Results

Instead, it's displayed as `Map { 0 => 81, 1 => 0, 2 => 0}`, the mapping keys from other failed attempts to create this contract having been inappropriately applied to this one.

## Environment

* Truffle version (`truffle version`): 5.4.26
